tag_list: cedric, teissier, cedric-teissier, boaties, nexkap, flip, flop, receivable, auction, founder, palico, private-equity, attorney
overview:
A former attorney turned into an addicted entrepreneur, Cédric is driven by an obsession to build highly dispruptive products and services in a variety of sectors. Passionate about financial technology, vertical networks, crowdsourcing, and anything remotely close to innovation in financial services, he is co-founder and CEO of NexKap, the first web-based platform dedicated to working capital financing in France, and co-founder and CEO of Boaties Production, the innovative shoe company.

Priori to founding NexKap and Boaties Production, Cédric co-founded Palico, the first online private equity fund marketplace bringing limited partners, general partners, placement agents and gatekeepers together – in one place – to meet and engage with qualified counterparts. With offices in Paris, London and New York City, Palico now assembles an unparalleled community of private equity participants coming from 50+ countries.

Before realising that his life should really be about creating products and services, Cédric held General Counsel positions within the private equity industry, and practiced as a private equity attorney in Debevoise & Plimpton’s New York and Paris offices, for more than 10 years.

Cédric earned a Master in International Business Law summa cum laude and a Master in Business Law, Tax and Accountancy summa cum laude from the University of Aix-Marseille III. He also holds an LL.M in entrepreneurship from Cornell Law School in Ithaca, NY.

Cédric is a member of the New York Bar and the Paris Bar, and is recommanded by Legal 500 as a leading lawyer for private equity in France. He is also a founding member of Finance Participative France, the French crowdfunding association.
